subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Review charts for Shavian Quikscript Extensions
msgSnippet: ... Eh? I don t follow you. ... Glyph shaping is font-dependent. Quikscript fonts will be different from Shavian fonts. ... To whom? ... Can it? Where is the
messageBody:
At 20:20 +0000 2007-11-01, amd64_hacker wrote:
>Okay, the numbering at the top of the tables threw me off.
>
>Context is the problem, how will the computer/font know an UTTER from an
>ADO in raw text?

Eh? I don't follow you.

>The obvious answer would seem to be to not use the alternate form of
>UTTER when the alphabet is unknown.

Glyph shaping is font-dependent. Quikscript fonts will be different
from Shavian fonts.

>The only problem with that is that the alphabet is going to be unknown
>in about 80+% of cases.

To whom?

>Shavian can be joined up like senior QS, there just hasn't been a font
>made which does that yet.

Can it? Where is the specification?
--
Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com
